name: John McCullough, Appellant, v. Oliver L. Blachley

judges: Before Green, Williams, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
parties: John McCullough, Appellant, v. Oliver L. Blachley.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Dean,
The facts and law in this case are precisely the same as in executors of Joseph Beabout against same defendant in which opinion has this day been handed down.
For the reasons therein given, this judgment is reversed and a procedendo is awarded.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Dean,

casebody.head_matter:
John McCullough, Appellant, v. Oliver L. Blachley.
November 14, 1898 :
Argued Oct. 31, 1898.
Appeal, No. 31, Oct. T., 1898, by plaintiff, from order of G. P. No. 3, Allegheny County, Feb. T., 1896, No. 64, refusing to take off nonsuit.
Before Green, Williams, McCollum, Mitchell, Dean and Fell, JJ.
Reversed.
